findings.title: Flashloan Attack
findings.description: When working with exchange rates, they should be received from a trusted source and not be vulnerable to short-term rate changes that can be achieved by using flash loans. Oracles should be used.

findings.title: Token Supply Manipulation
findings.description: Tokens can be minted only according to rules specified in a whitepaper or any other documentation provided by the Customer.

findings.title: Gas Limit and Loops
findings.description: Transaction execution costs should not depend dramatically on the amount of data stored on the contract. There should not be any cases when execution fails due to the block Gas limit.

findings.title: Requirements Compliance
findings.description: Contract does not comply with specified requirements, including Assets Integrity, User Balances Manipulation, and Data Consistency.

findings.title: Environment Consistency
findings.description: The project uses floating pragmas ^0.8.0 which may result in contracts being deployed using the wrong pragma version, different from the one they were tested with.

findings.title: Secure Oracles Usage
findings.description: The code should have the ability to pause specific data feeds that it relies on. This should be done to protect a contract from compromised oracles.

findings.title: Tests Coverage
findings.description: Code coverage of the project is 10% (branch coverage).

findings.title: Race Conditions
findings.description: Race Conditions and Transactions Order Dependency should not be possible.

findings.title: Authorization through tx.origin
findings.description: tx.origin should not be used for authorization.

findings.title: Block values as a proxy for time
findings.description: Block numbers should not be used for time calculations.

findings.title: Signature Unique Id
findings.description: Signed messages should always have a unique id. A transaction hash should not be used as a unique id. Chain identifiers should always be used. All parameters from the signature should be used in signer recovery. EIP-712 should be followed during a signer verification.

findings.title: Shadowing State Variable
findings.description: State variables should not be shadowed.

findings.title: Incorrect Inheritance Order
findings.description: When inheriting multiple contracts, especially if they have identical functions, a developer should carefully specify inheritance in the correct order.

findings.title: Calls Only to Trusted Addresses
findings.description: All external calls should be performed only to trusted addresses.

findings.title: Presence of Unused Variables
findings.description: Unused variables are present in the contract.

findings.title: EIP Standards Violation
findings.description: EIP standards should not be violated.

findings.title: All tokens are minted to a specific address
findings.description: The token contract mints all of its initial supply and sends it to a specific address, with no additional minting allowed.
